sentiment.analysis: The sentiment of this conversation is very negative. The user has encountered an error (exit code 128) while trying to interact with a Git repository. The error message states that the current directory is not a Git repository, or any parent up to the mount point "/mnt". This suggests that either the user tried to perform a Git command in the wrong directory or there is some issue with the project setup. The error also mentions "Stopping at filesystem boundary" indicating that the Git discovery process was halted due to crossing file system boundaries, which might be related to improper project configuration or permissions issues. Overall, this conversation indicates a problem that needs resolution for the user to continue working with Git.
